properties.address: The Hive Community Centre 53-55 Elliott Street Silsden, BD20 0DE
properties.description: Every Friday, we open between 1pm and 2.30pm for a FREE tea, coffee or a cold drink if preferred. We also invite guests from organisations who can offer advice on various topics. So don’t be lonely, don’t suffer in silence, come and join us at your local, friendly and caring, Community Centre.The office is open Monday to Friday from 9am until 3pm (Term Time only) and we welcome you if you need to warm up, have a chat, use the WiFi or just want to chat.Please note that this is subject to availability of staff, but we always try to provide a warm and welcome space to anyone who visits us.Official warm space time is Friday 1pm – 2.30pm term time only
properties.title: The Hive Community Centre

properties.description: The space available is warm and comfortable with a tea/coffee making area. It is called ‘Copperkettle’ and is where we usually hold our community hub which does not open on Fridays. There is direct access into the space but booking needs to be made via contact details above.

properties.description: We offer use of our welcome area, the opportunity to stay warm, enjoy a cuppa and charge your mobile phone, use our wifi etc Free lunch for those who otherwise could not afford to pay on a Thursday – tickets available in advance from reception.
properties.title: Baildon Community Link

properties.address: Newton Way, Baildon. , BD17 5NH
properties.description: Warm and friendly cafe area where people can have a free hot or cold drink (10:00 to 15:00 weekdays) and free soup and a roll between 12.00 and 13.30 each weekday. Community Pantry available on a help-yourself basis.Feeling a bit low? Come along on Monday afternoon and Wednesday morning to ‘Wellbeing at Wesleys’ for a warm welcome, someone to talk to and some optional mindful activities – or join in one of the many other activity groups that meet in our premises throughout the week.Signposting to information and advice services. Free use of wifi.
properties.title: Baildon Methodist Church and Wesleys Community Hub

properties.address: Dryden Street (Behind Lady Max on Main Street), Bingley, BD16 2LU, Dryden Street, Bingley, BD16 2LU
properties.description: Warm space for table top activities, company and conversation or separate space for reading (books available) and quieter activities. Hot drinks, soup etc.Baby changing facilities are available but there are no facilities for the older child. Feel free to bring your own suitable activity or reading material. You are very welcome.
